data.title: Robert Steele Obituary
data.meta_description: Robert Joseph ‘Packy’ Steele, Sr. EDDYVILLE - Robert Joseph “Packy” Steele, Sr., 73, of Cutler Hill Road, Eddyville, died Tuesday, May 13th, 2014 at
data.text:
Robert Joseph Steele OBITUARY

Robert Joseph ‘Packy’ Steele, Sr. EDDYVILLE – Robert Joseph “Packy” Steele, Sr., 73, of Cutler Hill Road, Eddyville, died Tuesday, May 13th, 2014 at HealthAlliance Hospital, Broadway Campus, Kingston. Robert was born in Kingston on Dec. 4, 1940, a son of the late Robert and Catherine (Kelder) Steele. On Nov. 30, 1963, he married Barbara Frances Tenaglia in Stamford, Conn. They recently celebrated their 50th wedding anniversary. After serving in the U.S. Army, he worked for Falk Exterminating, Stamford, Conn., which was owned by the brother of actor Peter Falk. In 1984, Robert ventured on his own and began Steele Pest Control in Eddyville, which celebrates it’s 30th year in business this year and is carried on by his son Robert Jr. Robert was skilled in the art of fly tying, and took pleasure in fly fishing for trout in the Esopus Creek in Phoenicia, and numerous streams in the Catskills. He enjoyed woodworking, and outdoor cooking, especially smoking the fish he caught. Most of all he cherished time with his family, and his canine Husky Shepherd companion, Lakota. In addition to his wife, Barbara Steele, he is survived by one son, Robert J. Steele, Jr. of Eddyville and his companion Annie, one daughter, Cindi Lynn Steele, and her companion James Dennison, of Kingston, and cousins: William and Robert “Red” Bence, Barbara Cercone, and Margaret Jordan, all of Kingston, as well as many nieces and nephews. Robert will be missed by all who knew and loved him. Funeral arrangements are under the care of Harry VanVliet IV of the Gilpatric-VanVliet Funeral Home, 339 Broadway, Ulster Park. The service will be held 2 p.m., Saturday at funeral Home, Rev. Eugene J. Grohe, celebrant. The Steele family will receive friends prior to the service from 11 a.m. to 2 p.m. Cremation will follow at Wiltwyck Crematory. Inurnment in the family plot at St. Mary’s Cemetery will be private. To send an expression of condolence, visit: www.GVVFH.com
